alert.note: Alert for Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 4:40PM CDT until April 28 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Chippewa River at Durand affecting Dunn, Pepin and Buffalo Counties. .Recent rainfall has lead to additional rises on area rivers. Crests will occur over the next few days. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chippewa River at Durand. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Highway 10 on the north approach to the bridge across the Chippewa River may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 14.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 300 PM CDT Friday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.4 feet on 04/15/2002. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
